text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fearâ€”not absence of it.

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus (tr. George Long)

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Latin Proverb

text: He who fears he shall suffer, already suffers what he fears.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: Do the next right thing, even if your hands shake.
author: Anonymous

text: Let your actions be louder than your anxieties.

text: Courage grows when you move, not when you wait.

text: Breathe, decide, step.

text: Fear is a rumor; test it with a step.

text: A soft heart can carry a brave life.

text: Risk the small embarrassment to gain the big life.

text: There are always two wolves: fear and resolve. Feed the second.

text: Let purpose be louder than panic.

text: Fear is data, not a dictator.

text: Try is a door most fears never open.

text: Your bravery can be quiet and still count.

text: You can be scared and show up anyway.
